title: These two online shopping platforms are rallying ahead of Amazon’s earnings
summary: Shares of Etsy Inc. and eBay Inc. ran higher over the course of the day on Wednesday, as a key demand metric for both online-shopping platforms topped expectations for the second quarter.
fullContent: Shares of Etsy Inc. and eBay Inc. ran higher over the course of the day on Wednesday, as a key demand metric for both online-shopping platforms topped expectations for the second quarter.

title: Arm drops some clues about its future, but they’re not enough to help the stock
summary: Arm said it’s exploring ways to expand its business, but investors seem focused on the chip-design company’s lukewarm outlook.
fullContent: Arm said it’s exploring ways to expand its business, but investors seem focused on the chip-design company’s lukewarm outlook.

title: Conversation with Frank Fabozzi, CFA, Featuring Joanne Hill and Larry Siegel
summary: 60 Years of Ideas that Changed Investing: CFA Institute Research Foundation at Work From efficient markets and asset pricing models to factor investing, artificial intelligence, and private markets, CFA Institute Research Foundation has helped shape modern investment thinking across six decades of evolution. Its open-access content—including monographs, briefs, literature reviews, and the Financial Thought Exchange podcast—has become an essential resource for professionals seeking rigorous, practitioner-relevant insight. In this conversation, Joanne Hill and Larry Siegel—two driving forces behind the Research Foundation’s evolution—explore some of its most influential contributions to the investment profession. Discussion topics include: Stocks, Bonds, Bills, and Inflation (SBBI), the dataset originally produced by Roger Ibbotson Seminal contributions from Nobel Laureates including William Sharpe, Robert Merton, and Harry Markowitz What’s ahead for research on AI, private markets, and
fullContent: 60 Years of Ideas that Changed Investing: CFA Institute Research Foundation at Work From efficient markets and asset pricing models to factor investing, artificial intelligence, and private markets, CFA Institute Research Foundation has helped shape modern investment thinking across six decades of evolution. Its open-access content—including monographs, briefs, literature reviews, and the Financial Thought Exchange podcast—has become an essential resource for professionals seeking rigorous, practitioner-relevant insight. In this conversation, Joanne Hill and Larry Siegel—two driving forces behind the Research Foundation’s evolution—explore some of its most influential contributions to the investment profession. title: Stocks in news: HUL, Swiggy, Tata Steel, Tata Motors, M&M
summary: Indian markets experienced marginal gains on Wednesday, influenced by mixed signals. Several companies are in the spotlight due to Q1 results, including HUL, Swiggy, Sun Pharma, and Maruti Suzuki. Tata Steel and M&M reported significant profit growth, while IndiGo's net profit declined.
fullContent: Indian markets experienced marginal gains on Wednesday, influenced by mixed signals. Several companies are in the spotlight due to Q1 results, including HUL, Swiggy, Sun Pharma, and Maruti Suzuki. Tata Steel and M&M reported significant profit growth, while IndiGo's net profit declined.

title: South Korea Reaches Trade Deal With Trump
summary: The agreement comes after other American allies, like Japan, clinched their own deals, partly to moderate President Trump’s tariff threats.
fullContent: A protest against President Trump’s trade policies near the American Embassy in Seoul on July 15.

title: Trump Announces Health Care Records System for Consumers
summary: The administration is working with tech companies to make sharing information with various providers easier. Experts raised concerns about privacy and security.
fullContent: President Trump on Wednesday at the White House with Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., left, and Mehmet Oz, the administrator for the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services.

title: US futures rise on tech earnings, dollar steadies
summary: US equity futures climbed following strong earnings from tech giants like Microsoft and Meta, despite a volatile Wall Street session. The dollar stabilized after the Federal Reserve held interest rates steady. Asian markets showed mixed performance, with South Korean equities fluctuating after a US trade deal. Investors are now focused on the Bank of Japan's rate decision.
fullContent: US equity futures climbed following strong earnings from tech giants like Microsoft and Meta, despite a volatile Wall Street session. The dollar stabilized after the Federal Reserve held interest rates steady. Asian markets showed mixed performance, with South Korean equities fluctuating after a US trade deal. Investors are now focused on the Bank of Japan's rate decision.

title: Qualcomm’s stock falls after earnings. Here’s where investors may be disappointed.
summary: Handset and automotive revenue came up short, but Qualcomm’s CFO says the company is in a good spot to benefit from the rise of smart glasses and changes to the car industry.
fullContent: Handset and automotive revenue came up short, but Qualcomm’s CFO says the company is in a good spot to benefit from the rise of smart glasses and changes to the car industry.

title: Sumant Kathpalia offers Rs 5.2 crore to settle insider trading case
summary: Former IndusInd Bank CEO Sumant Kathpalia has proposed a ₹5.21 crore settlement to SEBI regarding insider trading allegations. SEBI had barred Kathpalia and other executives for trading on unpublished price-sensitive information related to accounting discrepancies. Kathpalia's settlement application includes a pledge of confidentiality, while SEBI impounded ₹19.8 crore from the involved individuals.
fullContent: Former IndusInd Bank CEO Sumant Kathpalia has proposed a ₹5.21 crore settlement to SEBI regarding insider trading allegations. SEBI had barred Kathpalia and other executives for trading on unpublished price-sensitive information related to accounting discrepancies. Kathpalia's settlement application includes a pledge of confidentiality, while SEBI impounded ₹19.8 crore from the involved individuals.

title: Why are Indian households struggling with medical costs despite health initiatives?
summary: India's out-of-pocket health expenses are among the highest in major economies. Though it decreased from 2014 to 2024, it remains significant. China saw a smaller decrease in the same period. Emerging Asia's health protection gap has widened. Rising medical costs and coverage gaps are key issues. Many Indian families struggle to afford healthcare.
fullContent: India's out-of-pocket health expenses are among the highest in major economies. Though it decreased from 2014 to 2024, it remains significant. China saw a smaller decrease in the same period. Emerging Asia's health protection gap has widened. Rising medical costs and coverage gaps are key issues. Many Indian families struggle to afford healthcare.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Threaten to Deepen $248 Billion India Stock Rout
summary: India’s faltering equities market faces the risk of more losses after the nation was slapped with one of the highest tariff rates in Asia on its exports to the US.
fullContent: India’s faltering equities market faces the risk of more losses after the nation was slapped with one of the highest tariff rates in Asia on its exports to the US.

title: Trump Says US to Impose 15% Tariff on South Korean Goods
summary: US President Donald Trump has said he reached a trade deal with South Korea that would impose a 15% tariff on its exports to the US and see Seoul agree to $350 billion in US investments. Bloomberg's Bureau Editor Denny Thomas explains how the 15% tariff rate is the culmination of months of talks. (Source: Bloomberg)
fullContent: US President Donald Trump has said he reached a trade deal with South Korea that would impose a 15% tariff on its exports to the US and see Seoul agree to $350 billion in US investments. Bloomberg's Bureau Editor Denny Thomas explains how the 15% tariff rate is the culmination of months of talks. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Anant Ambani's appointment to RIL board gets shareholder nod
summary: Anant Ambani is now the executive director at Reliance Industries. Reliance Industries shareholders gave their approval. The RIL board appointed Mukesh Ambani's youngest son on April 25. Anant will serve for five years, starting May 1. He has been on the boards of Jio Platforms and Reliance Foundation. He also serves on Reliance New Energy and Reliance New Solar Energy.
fullContent: Anant Ambani is now the executive director at Reliance Industries. Reliance Industries shareholders gave their approval. The RIL board appointed Mukesh Ambani's youngest son on April 25. Anant will serve for five years, starting May 1. He has been on the boards of Jio Platforms and Reliance Foundation. He also serves on Reliance New Energy and Reliance New Solar Energy.

title: Samsung reports Q1 revenue up 0.7% YoY to $53.7B, vs. $53.6B est., operating profit down 55% YoY to $3.4B, vs. $3.8B est., with chips operating profit down ~94% (Dylan Butts/CNBC)
summary: Dylan Butts / CNBC: Samsung reports Q1 revenue up 0.7% YoY to $53.7B, vs. $53.6B est., operating profit down 55% YoY to $3.4B, vs. $3.8B est., with chips operating profit down ~94%  —  Samsung Electronics on Thursday reported a second-quarter operating profit of 4.7 trillion Korean won that missed expectations …
fullContent: Dylan Butts / CNBC: Samsung reports Q1 revenue up 0.7% YoY to $53.7B, vs. $53.6B est., operating profit down 55% YoY to $3.4B, vs. $3.8B est., with chips operating profit down ~94%  —  Samsung Electronics on Thursday reported a second-quarter operating profit of 4.7 trillion Korean won that missed expectations …

title: Will Tata Motors' ambitious Iveco acquisition strain its financial stability?
summary: Tata Motors' stock experienced a decline following reports of a possible acquisition of Iveco. The deal, valued at ₹3.9 billion, may require external funding for the Indian automaker. Analysts anticipate pressure on Tata Motors' balance sheet due to rising global tariff uncertainties. Iveco's revenue declined in FY24, but expects stable growth in 2025.
fullContent: Tata Motors' stock experienced a decline following reports of a possible acquisition of Iveco. The deal, valued at ₹3.9 billion, may require external funding for the Indian automaker. Analysts anticipate pressure on Tata Motors' balance sheet due to rising global tariff uncertainties. Iveco's revenue declined in FY24, but expects stable growth in 2025.

title: RBA’s Hauser Says CPI Is ‘Very Welcome,’ Job Market Under Debate
summary: Australia’s quarterly inflation outcome this week was close to the Reserve Bank’s expectations, Deputy Governor Andrew Hauser said, while adding the board is debating the extent of labor market tightness.
fullContent: Andrew Hauser

title: Vedanta Resources seeks investor nod to prepay $550-million debt
summary: Vedanta Resources aims to prepay a $550 million private credit facility by raising $700 million from banks like Barclays and Standard Chartered, seeking investor consent for early repayment. This refinancing targets a lower interest rate, around SOFR + 400-500 basis points, significantly reducing borrowing costs.
fullContent: Vedanta Resources aims to prepay a $550 million private credit facility by raising $700 million from banks like Barclays and Standard Chartered, seeking investor consent for early repayment. This refinancing targets a lower interest rate, around SOFR + 400-500 basis points, significantly reducing borrowing costs.

title: Spandana's top ten investors to buy into Rs 400-crore rights issue
summary: Spandana Sphoorty Financial's ₹400-crore rights issue, opening August 1, has secured participation from its top 10 institutional investors, including Kedaara Capital, which holds 48.13%. Despite a net loss in FY25, the company aims to restore stakeholder confidence through this issue. Kedaara Capital may extend its investment beyond its scheduled exit in September 2026.
fullContent: Spandana Sphoorty Financial's ₹400-crore rights issue, opening August 1, has secured participation from its top 10 institutional investors, including Kedaara Capital, which holds 48.13%. Despite a net loss in FY25, the company aims to restore stakeholder confidence through this issue. Kedaara Capital may extend its investment beyond its scheduled exit in September 2026.

title: Who’s Most At Risk From Trump’s 25% India Tariffs
summary: US President Donald Trump’s 25% tariff on Indian exports from Aug. 1 is expected to hurt a spate of sectors — from makers of electronics and generic drugs to jewelry and auto component firms.
fullContent: US President Donald Trump’s 25% tariff on Indian exports from Aug. 1 is expected to hurt a spate of sectors — from makers of electronics and generic drugs to jewelry and auto component firms.

title: Trump Imposes 50% Tariff on Semi-Finished Copper Products | Balance of Power: Late Edition 7/30/2025
summary: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Joseph Lavorgna, Counselor to Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, shares his opposing thoughts on Federal Reserve Chair Powell stating interest rates need to stay high to make sure President Trump's tariff policy only increases prices of goods once. Senator Jeanne Shaheen (D-NH) discusses the tariff uncertainty issues she is hearing from businesses in her state. Rep. Ryan Mackenzie (R-PA) talks about how his constituents feel about the Trump Tax Bill. Chapters: 00:00:00 - Late Edition of Balance Power Begins 00:01:54 - Laura Davison on Pres. title: Hot Stocks: 3 stocks that may give returns between 22-36%
summary: Analysts predict significant returns for NTPC, Ather Energy, and Varun Beverages. CLSA projects a 35.4% upside for NTPC, citing continued re-rating. NUVAMA initiates coverage on Ather Energy with a buy rating, anticipating strong growth in the EV sector. HSBC reiterates a buy rating for Varun Beverages, forecasting a 22.6% upside due to attractive valuations and growth potential.
fullContent: Analysts predict significant returns for NTPC, Ather Energy, and Varun Beverages. CLSA projects a 35.4% upside for NTPC, citing continued re-rating. NUVAMA initiates coverage on Ather Energy with a buy rating, anticipating strong growth in the EV sector. HSBC reiterates a buy rating for Varun Beverages, forecasting a 22.6% upside due to attractive valuations and growth potential.

title: Robinhood takes ‘victory lap’ after big jumps in quarterly profit and revenue
summary: Retail investors bought the recent stock market dip at record rates in response to volatility, likely helping boost Robinhood’s business.
fullContent: Retail investors bought the recent stock market dip at record rates in response to volatility, likely helping boost Robinhood’s business.

title: Ford warns its tariff hit will grow to $2 billion, offers downbeat  guidance
summary: Ford Motor Co. late Wednesday warned investors it will take a bigger hit this year from tariffs, and reinstated its outlook for the year.
fullContent: Ford Motor Co. late Wednesday warned investors it will take a bigger hit this year from tariffs, and reinstated its outlook for the year.

title: How will Trump's tariff announcement impact Indian stock market?
summary: Indian equities are expected to decline following Trump's tariff announcement, as indicated by a drop in GIFT Nifty futures. Nilesh Shah of Kotak Mahindra AMC anticipates a negative market reaction, despite expectations of a trade deal due to aligned US-India strategic interests. Export-oriented sectors are likely to face the most significant impact.
fullContent: Indian equities are expected to decline following Trump's tariff announcement, as indicated by a drop in GIFT Nifty futures. Nilesh Shah of Kotak Mahindra AMC anticipates a negative market reaction, despite expectations of a trade deal due to aligned US-India strategic interests. Export-oriented sectors are likely to face the most significant impact.

title: Why did Fed keep interest rates unchanged despite Trump's pressure?
summary: The Federal Reserve maintained its key short-term interest rate, defying President Trump's persistent calls for a reduction. The rate remains at 4.3%, a level established after three cuts last year, with officials citing the need to assess the impact of Trump's tariffs on inflation and the economy.
fullContent: The Federal Reserve maintained its key short-term interest rate, defying President Trump's persistent calls for a reduction. The rate remains at 4.3%, a level established after three cuts last year, with officials citing the need to assess the impact of Trump's tariffs on inflation and the economy.

title: Budweiser APAC Profit Misses Estimates as China Slowdown Weighs
summary: Budweiser Brewing Co APAC Ltd.’s second-quarter profit fell short of expectations, as beer consumption in China continued to decline as the country sees persistent consumer weakness.
fullContent: Budweiser beer. Photographer: Kyle Lam/Bloomberg

title: Korea’s Market Pauses Rally as Trump Deal Spurs Profit-Taking
summary: South Korean equities traded within tight ranges on Thursday following six days of advances as the Asian nation clinched a trade deal with US President Donald Trump.
fullContent: South Korean equities traded within tight ranges on Thursday following six days of advances as the Asian nation clinched a trade deal with US President Donald Trump.

title: Meta expects 2025 capital expenditures to be between $66B and $72B, raising the low end of the company's previous estimate of $64B to $72B (Jonathan Vanian/CNBC)
summary: Jonathan Vanian / CNBC: Meta expects 2025 capital expenditures to be between $66B and $72B, raising the low end of the company's previous estimate of $64B to $72B  —  Meta shares jumped 10% after the company reported second-quarter earnings on Wednesday that beat on revenue.  Here's how the company did, compared with estimates from analysts polled by LSEG:

title: Copper Gains in London After Trump Tariffs Exclude Refined Metal
summary: Copper rose in London — following a collapse in New York — after US President Donald Trump shocked the metals world by exempting the most widely traded forms of copper from his hotly anticipated import tariffs.
fullContent: A spool of copper wire in storage.

title: The Blockchain, AI and the American Economy
summary: Aaron Kennon, Chief Executive Officer of Clear Harbor Asset Management, discusses investors' surging interest in cryptocurrencies and related products, AI's potential impact on the economy, as well as his market outlook for the third quarter and beyond. Aaron speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on Bloomberg Businessweek Daily. (Source: Bloomberg)
fullContent: Aaron Kennon, Chief Executive Officer of Clear Harbor Asset Management, discusses investors' surging interest in cryptocurrencies and related products, AI's potential impact on the economy, as well as his market outlook for the third quarter and beyond. Aaron speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on Bloomberg Businessweek Daily. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Parliament Monsoon Session: PM Modi बोले तो विपक्ष में हलचल! शुरू हुआ सियासी संग्राम | Congress
summary: संसद के मानसून सत्र का आज (30 जुलाई) आठवां दिन है. राज्यसभा में ऑपरेशन सिंदूर पर लगातार दूसरे दिन चर्चा होगी. इस बीच पीएम मोदी द्वारा दिए गए बयान को लेकर पक्ष-विपक्ष में वार-पलटवार का सिलसिला देखने को मिल रहा है। क्या कुछ कहा, सुनिए.... #parliamentmonsoonsession #pmmodi #rahulgandhi #mallikarjunkharge न्यूज़18 इंडिया भारत का नंबर 1 न्यूज चैनल है। जो 24 घंटे आप तक देश और दुनिया की हर खबर पहुँचाता है। राजनीति, मनोरंजन, बॉलीवुड, खेल के साथ साथ आप तक वो हर खबर हम पहुँचाते हैं जो आपके लिए महत्वपूर्ण है। इसलिए बने रहें हमारे साथ और सब्सक्राइब करें हमारा YouTube चैनल #News18IndiaNumber1 News18 India is India's No.1 hindi News Channel.
